reviewerName: Amazon Customer "Use Open Source - Firefox, etc"
reviewText: I haven't thought a lot about Loggins and Messina for years.Then I saw a video of them, ALL GROWN UP, going Crazy Eyes one late night on HD cable.I absolutely flipped. Their music was years before its time. The arrangements were spectacular, their harmonies perfect, their band was just great.I searched found the DVD and I saw that my impressions were just like the impressions of the other 5 star reviews.Class, talent, unique sounds, great memories. I was so happy to hear Jim Messina do a song from one of my favorite groups from the past, Poco. I always thought of Poco as The Eagles with talent and without the egos.Just great. A warm, wonderful DVD. Get it, relax and enjoy.jon
Title: N/A

reviewText: Lord knows I've listenned to a lot of concert dvds. This is the best. Hands down.  And I'm not a huge Loggins and Messina fan. So there ya go. Now, I am a big Buffalo Springfield and Poco fan, and Jim Messina is just an amazing guitar player and singer. Kenny L too. And the backup band here is beyond belief. First rate! This concert is one of the best ever. Outstanding performances - great song selection - can't do any better.  And for a "regular" dvd, excellent video and sound. If this ever comes out in blu-ray, get it! Immediately!
Title: N/A

reviewText: FANTASTIC SHOW!The whole concert is fantastic but the absolute knock-out performance for me was "Peace of Mind".  Kenny Loggins definitely WOWED the crowd on this one! At first he's just trolling around the stage seemingly almost to lull everyone to sleep with this peaceful ballad.  Then, SUDDENLY,...out of nowhere and without any warning he belts out more soul than anyone ever thought possible from a white man. I've watched this a dozen times and it gives me chills every single time.Also, "Danny's Song" has got to be not just one of L&M;'s best songs, it has to be one of the finest songs of all time -- period!  The instrumentation and the lyrics literally bring tears to my eyes.  The one line in the song that so obviously resonates with everyone is, "EVERYTHING IS GONNA BE ALRIGHT".  You can hear the audience sing that part with so much enthusiasm.  Everyone wants to believe, to hope, and to hear that....."Everything is gonna be alright." And after you watch and listen to this DVD it will make you feel just exactly that way.If you are a Loggins and Messina fan you definitely want this DVD.If you are not a Loggins and Messina fan you WILL BE after seeing this.
summary: SO VERY HAPPY TO OWN THIS!
Title: N/A

reviewText: One of the best concert DVDs in recent years. I just can't describe it. It was like I was there. I'm to young to remember Kenny and Jimmy but the songs are fantastic. I don't know how to rate each song but they are superb!Starting out with a little commentary from Kenny Loggins and Jim Messina (it's easy to know who's talking), we get into the move with "Watching the River Run" and we feel as if we're back in '73! Then we're transported back to our childhood with "House at Pooh Corner" and as with most Loggins concerts the audience sings along "Count all the bees in the hive, chase all the clouds in the sky"... Then it gets a little somber with "Sailin' the Wind" because we see footage of the little known sax and woodwind player Jon Clarke who passed on shortly beforethe tour began (Jon is honored again, well sort of with the same song, he looks sort of like the Kenny G of his time) Steve Nieves and the other reed player both do a good job channeling Clarke... Then Messina takes us back to growing up in Texas with two country songs, "Changes"and then it's "Back to Georgia".Then comes a three song medley the best of which is Jimmy's "Peace ofMind" in which Kenny does a knockout performance that I would love to see him do in his own shows. Then it's the ever popular "Your Mama Don't Dance", then a brief break where the fans get to share their memories of L&M.; Then we get the "General Store" acoustic set "A Love Song","Thinking of You" (for one of Jimmy's girlfriends in the audience) and weare taken back to Jimmy's own roots with a cover of Buffalo Springfield's"Kind Woman" (with a brief cameo by Richie Furay. The rest I don't want to leave out so many surprises. The only complaint is that so many songs were left out of the CD companion. I forgot to mention "Long TailCat" another Loggins gem. Oh well great show boys!
summary: Reunited "Off the Coast of Santa Barbara

reviewText: It is so much fun to watch the musicians perform in live settings, and this DVD showcases a reunion that really brings back great memories from the past. Terrific selection of their songs. I highly recommend this for all Loggins and Messina fans and those who want to experience a bit of what those of us lucky enough to be part of the 70s music fan base. This duo was absolutely among the finest, IMHO.
Title: N/A

reviewText: You normally don't expect much from reunions of long defunct bands. The performances are usually by the numbers, the vocalists have lost a lot of range, etc., etc. Prepare to be pleasantly surprised by this reunion, though. The backing band is entirely different from the original L & M band, but this group knows how to play these tunes, and adds some nice touches to the arrangements. Also, Kenny & Jim can still sing well.A good selection of their catalog is played, no new material, but a well done cover of Buffalo Springfield's "Kind Woman" is performed. I've watched this dvd on 3 consecutive evenings, and  enjoyed it more each time.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Having grown up with Rock & Roll Hall-Of-Fame legends like the Everly Brothers, Buffalo Springfield, Lennon-McCartney, etc. Jim Messina (Producer and singer from Buffalo Springfield)and Kenny Loggins get together again in 2005 to combine their excellent voices, writing skills and musicianship to give us a fine performance at the outdoors Santa Barbara Bowl. Excellent musicians accompany them in this superb recording and camera video editing, that your 5.1 HT will sparkle, making you feel like you were actually there. Songs like "Be Free" and "Angry Eyes" recalls the days when songs were lose, jazzy, rocky, inspirational with guitar and sax licks with outstanding musicianship, something that is completely lacking in today's rock & roll arena in general. This is a superb DVD that should be played loud. Enjoy those voices and feelings, as true talent like these are hard to come by! Buy it with confidence, as you have over two hours of music.
summary: Legendary Duo Returns With Superb Live Performance History!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Watching past their prime rockers.  Until the last few years this wasn't an issue, to speak of, as there simply were hardly any going except for The Stones.  Now, a fair amount of 70's rock bands once again tour and many are making up for not having the technology for releasing videos of their concerts in their glory years by doing so now.  This can cause a dilema of sorts.The dilema of any bands whose prime was around 35 years ago is just that.  A few years, a little fire lost.  Fifteen years, the musical tastes of the market is now rooted in newer much different styles.  Thirty five years, can you still even play without eliciting only sympathy?  Most of these reunions end up doing a disservice to the memory of what was once good.  Of those that do work, there are those that are clearly "money grabs" whereby the are repectable, yet fail to raise the quality of the songs enough to be memorable.  Finally, there are a few reunions that come off in such a good way as to be totally unexpected.  When a concert like this is found it is so special,  it's obvious the songs were, and are, still relavent (i.e., good) and the artists still have real talent.Loggins & Messina Live:  Sittin' In Again should make any fan, hardcore or causual,  quite proud.  With journeyman like skill Kenny and Jim don't just look nice for their age they sing and play as good as they ever have which says alot for them.  They have assembled a great backing band, one that is totally locked in and can deliver on a high plane.  Throw in that the video was professionally shot at The Santa Baraba Bowl and it's a real treat all the way around.  Recommended.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Loggins & Messina are one of my favorites from the 70s. I still have all of their gold records on vinyl (all of their records were gold!) including their two double lp live records. These guys adapt reggie, blue grass, country,jazz, and 50s rock and roll into a very unique sound. After nearly 30 years, you would think rust would start to show! Not so with Loggins & Messina. Though they are older, they are much more accomplished in their music. Jim Messina goes way back to the 60s and Buffalo Springfield with Neil Young and Steven Stills. Buffalo Springfield played a variety of styles and this influence carries over into Loggins & Messina's sound.I enjoyed Steven Stills Manassas albums from the early 70s that have the same diverse styles of music as L & M. It is interesting to compare Manassas to L & M. L & M nail what Stills tried to do with Manassas plus the vocals and harmonies are much better. They still are! Jim Messina also does not look and sing like a whacked out druggie as do some of the CSN&Y; memebers.On the DVD you will experience the L & M sound. The backing band is tremendous. The technical aspects of the DVD are just superb as well. As we used to say in the old days at Disneyland, this DVD is an "E" ticket.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I own at least 50 concert DVD's, and this is the first time I am submitting a review.  Being a huge fan, I ordered this a couple days before it was released.  It far exceeded my expectations.  They played most of their good songs, and the sound and picture quality is superb.  Their vocals were just as they were 30 years ago, and they played the songs almost identical or better to the original recordings.  The back up band was first rate, and they played every note as it appeared on their original recordings.  I will watch this over and over again.
Title: N/A

reviewText: These gentlemen first came into the limelight in the early 70s. I purchased "Sittin In" back then because Jim Messina had been in Buffalo Springfield (briefly). He then went on to form the excellent band Poco with Richie Furay (of Buffalo Springfield), Rusty Young and Randy Meisner (soon to be an Eagle) et al.Fast forward over 30 years and after divorces, personal interaction issues etc. they reformed and made this DVD (and an accompanying CD). The backup band is superb (!!!), the sound is great, the video is not bad and most importantly - the music is as great and as vibrant as ever. Excellent versions (Angry Eyes, Be Free, Danny's Song, Vahevala, Same Old Wine, Changes,  etc.) of all their major songs and the Messina and Loggins seem to be enjoying themselves immensely. I recommend this to the casual fan and dedicated fan. Really a superb, enjoyable DVD (the CD is not as complete as the DVD but is also good).
Title: N/A

reviewText: The best thing I can say about any recent DVD release from a concert tour/show is ....it makes me hate myself for missing the show when they played in  my town...and this absolutely qualifies.I'd heard rumours that the boys were looking old and sounding  old and blew off the show....MY LOSS as this DVD clearly points out...it was a very democratic song selection  and all classic L&M; (no  painful Kenny solo stuff)...and the band rocks.This  DVD is a beautifully produced item featuring a 2 hour show (not the typical 1 hour abbreviated show we often  get)...and the bonus footage back from "the day" on  the Midnight special is a GAS!!This is a "No Brainer" if you are a fan ...and you must be or you wouldn't be reading  this.  Small investment..priceless return in  fun  music, wonderful picking...great harmonnies...good times!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been a fan of Kenny and Jimmy since I was a wee lad. It is so great that this DVD was produced so that those of us who have never seen them live, could enjoy their wonderful collaborative talents. This is a really nice package, with some good extras (The Midnight Special show from 1973) and a strong lineup of their best songs and hits. The setting for the concert is wonderful and the video and audio quality are excellent. All in all, a well packaged DVD that should become a part of your collection.
summary: Strong Concert DVD: Add to your collection
Title: N/A

reviewText: As a long time fan and a musician myself, I am so glad these two did this tour and made a DVD of it. I only regret that I just now found out that it was available. Kenny and Jim have been favorites of mine since around 1972. I have all the albums on vinyl and CD, plus most of their solo work as well.This concert is well played, and mixed to a "T". The solos are spot on and the band establishes very close to the same grooves as the 1970's recordings. I do wish they would have done some impomtu jams that let them stretch and show how they have expanded their talent in the last 30 plus years, but I'm not complaining as I'm so pleased just to have this.I also like the addition of the 1975 "Midnight Special" performance, that was a rare Friday night that I was home and not playing in some honky-tonk on the road myself.Their music and songs are timeless and could be played today as hit records to a whole new audience.Buy this DVD and/or Cd .....I promise you won't regret it.
summary: Loggins and Mesina, Back and Better Than Ever
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have followed L&M; for many years.  The first time I met Jimmy Messina was at Robarts Sports Arena in Sarasota, FL in April of 1968 with a little band called The Buffalo Springfield (they opened for The Beach Boys!).  A few "good men" came out of that band-Richie Furay of Poco, Neil Young and Stephen Stills, making it one of the true super groups to come out of the 60's.I next worked L&M; several times in 1974 or 1975, can't remember that far back.  They were great then.We were out of the country and missed them when they came to Florida this summer.  What a mistake that was.When I saw this DVD I was very impressed-even blown away.  With the advancements in technology of today combined with the wonderful legacy of music and musical maturity these guys gave us a truly memorable experience.  I put it on the home studio system and cranked it to concert level.  Holy mackerel!Kenny and Jim, I know it's a pain to tour but please tour again next summer.  Your DVD and CD have laid the groundwork for another successful tour.
